text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL have failed with a £55million bid for Torino striker Andrea Belotti, according to the Serie A side. 
Arsene Wenger has been keeping a close eye on the 23-year-old sensation who has scored 13 top-flight goals already this season, in just 16 appearances for the mid-table side. Getty Images 2 Andrea Belotti has a massive buyout clause to scare off Arsenal 
Real Madrid and Barcelona are tracking the phenomenal forward who won the Serie B title with Palermo in 2014 with 10 league goals. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog . EPA 2 The Torino and Italy striker is being scouted by top clubs 
Torino snapped the marksman up in August 2015 for just £6million and the club’s sporting director, Gianluca Petrachi, claims they’ve turned down the giant offer from Arsene Wenger’s side . 
When asked if the Premier League contenders had tabled a firm bid, he said: “Yes, we received the offer, but it does not reflect the value of the player. 
“Anyway, he is going nowhere for now. We want to enjoy him, then we’ll see what happens. “We intend to keep Belotti and President Urbano Cairo signed this important buy-out clause. 
"I think he’s worth more than they have offered.” 
The Italy international reportedly has a buyout clause of £85m which the frugal Frenchman would not fancy parting with.
